verses.kjv: The hand of the LORD was upon me, and carried me out in the spirit of the LORD, and set me down in the midst of the valley which was full of bones,
verses.web: LORD’s hand was on me, and he brought me out in LORD’s Spirit, and set me down in the middle of the valley; and it was full of bones.
verses.ct: The LORD's hand came upon me, and his spirit carried me out and set me down in the middle of a valley — and it was full of bones.

verses.kjv: And caused me to pass by them round about: and, behold, there were very many in the open valley; and, lo, they were very dry.
verses.web: He caused me to pass by them all around: and behold, there were very many in the open valley; and behold, they were very dry.
verses.ct: He led me back and forth among them, and I saw that there were an enormous number of bones scattered across the open valley. They were completely dried out.

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, Son of man, can these bones live? And I answered, O Lord GOD, thou knowest.
verses.web: He said to me, “Son of man, can these bones live?” I answered, “Lord LORD, you know.”
verses.ct: He asked me, "Son of man, can these bones live again?" I answered, "Lord GOD, only you know that."

verses.kjv: Again he said unto me, Prophesy upon these bones, and say unto them, O ye dry bones, hear the word of the LORD.
verses.web: Again he said to me, “Prophesy over these bones, and tell them, ‘You dry bones, hear LORD’s word.
verses.ct: Then he told me, "Prophesy over these bones. Say to them: 'Dry bones, hear the word of the LORD!'

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD unto these bones; Behold, I will cause breath to enter into you, and ye shall live:
verses.web: The Lord LORD says to these bones: “Behold, I will cause breath to enter into you, and you will live.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD says to these bones: 'I am going to put breath into you, and you will live.

verses.kjv: And I will lay sinews upon you, and will bring up flesh upon you, and cover you with skin, and put breath in you, and ye shall live; and ye shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.web: I will lay sinews on you, and will bring up flesh on you, and cover you with skin, and put breath in you, and you will live. Then you will know that I am LORD.” ’ ”
verses.ct: I will attach tendons to you, cover you with flesh, wrap you in skin, and breathe life into you. You will live — and then you will know that I am the LORD.'"

verses.kjv: So I prophesied as I was commanded: and as I prophesied, there was a noise, and behold a shaking, and the bones came together, bone to his bone.
verses.web: So I prophesied as I was commanded. As I prophesied, there was a noise, and behold, there was an earthquake. Then the bones came together, bone to its bone.
verses.ct: So I prophesied as I was commanded. As I spoke, there was a rattling sound and a great shaking, and the bones began coming together — each bone connecting to its matching bone.

verses.kjv: And when I beheld, lo, the sinews and the flesh came up upon them, and the skin covered them above: but there was no breath in them.
verses.web: I saw, and, behold, there were sinews on them, and flesh came up, and skin covered them above; but there was no breath in them.
verses.ct: As I watched, tendons appeared on them, then flesh grew over them, and skin covered them completely. But there was still no breath in them.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto me, Prophesy unto the wind, prophesy, son of man, and say to the wind, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Come from the four winds, O breath, and breathe upon these slain, that they may live.
verses.web: Then he said to me, “Prophesy to the wind, prophesy, son of man, and tell the wind, ‘The Lord LORD says: “Come from the four winds, breath, and breathe on these slain, that they may live.” ’ ”
verses.ct: Then he said to me, "Prophesy to the wind, son of man! Say to it: 'This is what the Lord GOD says: Come from the 4 winds, O breath, and breathe into these slain bodies so they may live!'"

verses.kjv: So I prophesied as he commanded me, and the breath came into them, and they lived, and stood up upon their feet, an exceeding great army.
verses.web: So I prophesied as he commanded me, and the breath came into them, and they lived, and stood up on their feet, an exceedingly great army.
verses.ct: So I prophesied as he commanded me, and breath entered them. They came alive and stood up on their feet — a vast, enormous army.

verses.kjv: Then he said unto me, Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel: behold, they say, Our bones are dried, and our hope is lost: we are cut off for our parts.
verses.web: Then he said to me, “Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel. Behold, they say, ‘Our bones are dried up, and our hope is lost. We are completely cut off.’
verses.ct: Then he told me, "Son of man, these bones represent the whole house of Israel. They are saying, 'Our bones are dried up. Our hope is gone. We've been completely cut off.'

verses.kjv: Therefore prophesy and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, O my people, I will open your graves, and cause you to come up out of your graves, and bring you into the land of Israel.
verses.web: Therefore prophesy, and tell them, ‘The Lord LORD says: “Behold, I will open your graves, and cause you to come up out of your graves, my people; and I will bring you into the land of Israel.
verses.ct: So prophesy and tell them: 'This is what the Lord GOD says: My people, I am going to open your graves and raise you out of them, and I will bring you back to the land of Israel.

verses.kjv: And ye shall know that I am the LORD, when I have opened your graves, O my people, and brought you up out of your graves,
verses.web: You will know that I am LORD, when I have opened your graves, and caused you to come up out of your graves, my people.
verses.ct: You will know that I am the LORD when I open your graves and bring you up out of them, my people.

verses.kjv: And shall put my spirit in you, and ye shall live, and I shall place you in your own land: then shall ye know that I the LORD have spoken it, and performed it, saith the LORD.
verses.web: I will put my Spirit in you, and you will live. Then I will place you in your own land; and you will know that I, LORD, have spoken it and performed it,” says LORD.’ ”
verses.ct: I will put my spirit in you, and you will live. I will settle you back in your own land, and you will know that I, the LORD, have spoken it and done it," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: The word of the LORD came again unto me, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came again to me, saying,
verses.ct: The word of the LORD came to me again:

verses.kjv: Moreover, thou son of man, take thee one stick, and write upon it, For Judah, and for the children of Israel his companions: then take another stick, and write upon it, For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim, and for all the house of Israel his companions:
verses.web: “You, son of man, take one stick, and write on it, ‘For Judah, and for the children of Israel his companions.’ Then take another stick, and write on it, ‘For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim, and for all the house of Israel his companions.’
verses.ct: "Son of man, take a stick and write on it: 'For Judah and the Israelites allied with him.' Then take another stick and write on it: 'For Joseph — the stick of Ephraim — and all the Israelites allied with him.'

verses.kjv: And join them one to another into one stick; and they shall become one in thine hand.
verses.web: Then join them for yourself to one another into one stick, that they may become one in your hand.
verses.ct: Now join them together into a single stick so that they become one in your hand.

verses.kjv: And when the children of thy people shall speak unto thee, saying, Wilt thou not shew us what thou meanest by these?
verses.web: “When the children of your people speak to you, saying, ‘Won’t you show us what you mean by these?’
verses.ct: When your people ask you, 'Won't you explain what you mean by this?'

verses.kjv: Say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I will take the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel his fellows, and will put them with him, even with the stick of Judah, and make them one stick, and they shall be one in mine hand.
verses.web: tell them, ‘The Lord LORD says: “Behold, I will take the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel his companions; and I will put them with it, with the stick of Judah, and make them one stick, and they will be one in my hand.
verses.ct: tell them: 'This is what the Lord GOD says: I am going to take Joseph's stick, which is in Ephraim's hand, along with the Israelite tribes allied with him, and join it to Judah's stick. I will make them into one stick, and they will be one in my hand.'

verses.kjv: And the sticks whereon thou writest shall be in thine hand before their eyes.
verses.web: The sticks on which you write will be in your hand before their eyes.” ’
verses.ct: Hold up the sticks you've written on so the people can see them.

verses.kjv: And say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I will take the children of Israel from among the heathen, whither they be gone, and will gather them on every side, and bring them into their own land:
verses.web: Say to them, ‘The Lord LORD says: “Behold, I will take the children of Israel from among the nations, where they have gone, and will gather them on every side, and bring them into their own land.
verses.ct: Then say to them: 'This is what the Lord GOD says: I am going to take the people of Israel out of the nations where they've gone. I will gather them from every direction and bring them back to their own land.

verses.kjv: And I will make them one nation in the land upon the mountains of Israel; and one king shall be king to them all: and they shall be no more two nations, neither shall they be divided into two kingdoms any more at all:
verses.web: I will make them one nation in the land, on the mountains of Israel. One king will be king to them all. They will no longer be two nations. They won’t be divided into two kingdoms any more at all.
verses.ct: I will make them one nation in the land, on the mountains of Israel. One king will rule over all of them. They will never again be 2 nations, and they will never again be divided into 2 kingdoms.

verses.kjv: Neither shall they defile themselves any more with their idols, nor with their detestable things, nor with any of their transgressions: but I will save them out of all their dwellingplaces, wherein they have sinned, and will cleanse them: so shall they be my people, and I will be their God.
verses.web: They won’t defile themselves any more with their idols, nor with their detestable things, nor with any of their transgressions; but I will save them out of all their dwelling places, in which they have sinned, and will cleanse them. So they will be my people, and I will be their God.
verses.ct: They will no longer defile themselves with their idols, their disgusting practices, or any of their sins. I will rescue them from every place where they sinned and will cleanse them. They will be my people, and I will be their God.

verses.kjv: And David my servant shall be king over them; and they all shall have one shepherd: they shall also walk in my judgments, and observe my statutes, and do them.
verses.web: “ ‘ “My servant David will be king over them. They all will have one shepherd. They will also walk in my ordinances, and observe my statutes, and do them.
verses.ct: My servant David will be their king, and they will all have one shepherd. They will follow my laws, obey my commands, and carry them out.

verses.kjv: And they shall dwell in the land that I have given unto Jacob my servant, wherein your fathers have dwelt; and they shall dwell therein, even they, and their children, and their children’s children for ever: and my servant David shall be their prince for ever.
verses.web: They will dwell in the land that I have given to Jacob my servant, in which your fathers lived. They will dwell therein, they, and their children, and their children’s children, forever. David my servant will be their prince forever.
verses.ct: They will live in the land I gave to my servant Jacob, where their ancestors lived. They and their children and their grandchildren will live there forever, and my servant David will be their ruler forever.

verses.kjv: Moreover I will make a covenant of peace with them; it shall be an everlasting covenant with them: and I will place them, and multiply them, and will set my sanctuary in the midst of them for evermore.
verses.web: Moreover I will make a covenant of peace with them. It will be an everlasting covenant with them. I will place them, multiply them, and will set my sanctuary among them forever more.
verses.ct: I will make a covenant of peace with them — an everlasting covenant. I will establish them, increase their numbers, and place my sanctuary among them forever.

verses.kjv: My tabernacle also shall be with them: yea, I will be their God, and they shall be my people.
verses.web: My tent also will be with them. I will be their God, and they will be my people.
verses.ct: My dwelling place will be with them. I will be their God, and they will be my people.

verses.kjv: And the heathen shall know that I the LORD do sanctify Israel, when my sanctuary shall be in the midst of them for evermore.
verses.web: The nations will know that I am LORD who sanctifies Israel, when my sanctuary is among them forever more.” ’ ”
verses.ct: The nations will know that I am the LORD who sets Israel apart as holy, when my sanctuary stands among them forever."
